sen.e: Jizo Bosatsu, d kSiti gharbha in Sanskrit, is one of the venerable entities of Bosatsu, which is worshipped in Buddhism.

sen.j: とう利天に在って釈迦仏の付属を受け、毎朝禅定に入りて衆生の機根(性格や教えを聞ける器）を感じ、釈迦の入滅後、56億7000万年後に弥勒菩薩が出現するまでの間、現世に仏が不在となってしまうため、その間、六道（地獄道・餓鬼道・畜生道・修羅道・人道・天道）を輪廻する衆生を救う菩薩であるとされる。
sen.e: It is considered that it follows Shaka-muni buddha in the Touriten, and feels capability of living things in every morning Dhyana - Meditation and that it is a Bosatsu to lelieve living things who live in the wheel of life of Rikudo (the six realms of Jigoku-do (地獄道), Gaki-do (餓鬼道),Chikusho-do (畜生道), Shura-do (修羅道), Jin-do (人道) and Ten-do (天道), while there exists no Buddha in this world after Shaka entered nirvana and before Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Bodhisattva) appeares in 5670 million years later.

It is considered that it follows Shaka-muni Buddha in the Touriten (Trayastrimsa heaven) and senses the capability of living things each morning in Dhyana (meditation), and that it is a Bosatsu that relieves living things who live in the wheel of life of Rikudo (the six realms of Jigoku-do (地獄道), Gaki-do, (餓鬼道), Chikusho-do (畜生道), Shura-do (修羅道), Jin-do (Human realm) (人道) and Ten-do (天道), while there exists no Buddha in this world after Shaka entered nirvana and before Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Bodhisattva) appears, 5670 million years later.

It is considered that it follows Shaka-muni Buddha in the Touriten (Trayastrimsa heaven) and senses the capability of living things each morning in Dhyana (meditation), and that it is a Bosatsu that relieves living things who live in the wheel of life of Rikudo (the six realms of Jigoku-do (Naraka realm, or hell realm) (地獄道), Gaki-do (Preta realm, or hungry ghost realm), (餓鬼道), Chikusho-do (Animal realm) (畜生道), Shura-do (Ashura realm, or realm of demigods) (修羅道), Jin-do (Human realm) (人道) and Ten-do (Deva realm, or realm or blissful state) (天道), while there exists no Buddha in this world after Shaka entered nirvana and before Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Bodhisattva) appears, 5670 million years later.
sen.cmt: Jigoku-do (Naraka realm, or hell realm) (地獄道), Gaki-do (Preta realm, or hungry ghost realm), (餓鬼道), Chikusho-do (Animal realm) (畜生道), Shura-do (Ashura realm, or realm of demigods) (修羅道), Jin-do (Human realm) (人道) and Ten-do (Deva realm, or realm or blissful state) (天道) とそれぞれに補足をしました。

sen.j: 一般には剃髪した声聞・比丘形（僧侶の姿）で袈裟をまとい、左手に如意宝珠、右手に錫杖を持つ形、または左手に如意宝珠を持ち、右手は与願印（掌をこちらに向け、下へ垂らす）の印相をとる像が多い。

sen.j: しかし、密教では胎蔵曼荼羅地蔵院の主尊として、髪を高く結い上げ装身具を身に着けた通常の菩薩形に表され、右手は右胸の前で日輪を持ち、左手は左腰に当てて幢幡を乗せた蓮華を持つ。
sen.e: However, in Mikkyo it is expressed in the normal figure which piles its hair high and puts ascessary as a principal image of Garbha-mandala Jizo-in, and it has Nichirin (日輪) in front of right-side breast in the right hand and has a lotus which puts on Doban with placing the left hand on the left hip.
sen.cmt: 「左手は左腰に当てて幢幡を乗せた蓮華を持つ」→腰に手を当てながら持つのは不自然ですがそのまま訳しました。「日輪」は英訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: However, in Mikkyo it is expressed in the normal figure that piles its hair high and wears accessory as a principal image of Garbha-mandala Jizo-in; it has Nichirin (日輪) in front of the right-side breast in the right hand and has a lotus that bears Doban while placing the left hand on the left hip.

sen.j: 二十八種利益
sen.e: Twenty-eight benefits
Twenty-eight benefits

sen.j: 1. 天龍護念、2. 善果日増、3. 集聖上因、4. 菩提不退、5. 衣食豊足、6. 疾疫不臨、7. 離水火災、8. 無盗賊厄、9. 人見欽敬、10. 神鬼助持、11. 女転男身、12. 為王臣女、13. 端正相好、14. 多生天上、15. 或為帝王、16. 宿智命通、17. 有求皆従、18. 眷属歓楽、19. 諸横消滅、20. 業道永除、21. 去処盡通、22. 夜夢安楽、23. 先亡離苦、24. 宿福受生、25. 諸聖讃歎、26. 聰明利根、27. 饒慈愍心、28. 畢竟成佛
sen.e: 1. The Tenryu (protective deities) will guard and defend thee, 2. The fruits of goodness & virture will shine increasingly on thee., 3. The wisdom of the sages shall accumulate within thee., 4. No retreat along the Bodhi path will be suffered by thee., 5. Food, drink, and clothing will not be lacking thee., 6. Disease and illness will not harm thee., 7. Calamities of fire and water will not hurt thee., 8. Thieves and robbers will not trouble thee., 9. Respect from others will come upon thee., 10. Demonic spirits shall (even) aid thee., 11. From female to male transformed will become thee., 12. Female minister to kings shall become thee., 13. Comely in appearance shall be thee., 14. Constant rebirth in deva heaven shall be accorded thee., 15. The role of monarch may fall unto thee., 16. Wisdom from previous lives shall illuminate the future for thee., 17. All those who beseech thee shall follow thee., 18. A joyous and content family shall be granted thee., 19. Chance, falsehood, and untrue doctrines shall cease to thwart thee., 20. Eternal freedom from the karmic chain shall be thine., 21. No obstacles along any path shall obstruct thee., 22. Peaceful and untroubled dreams will slumber bring thee., 23. Thy ancestors who suffer from evil karma shall be liberated., 24. Reborn shall they be based on the good karma of thy past life., 25. Praised by the sages shall become thee., 26. Intelligent and wise in nature shall become thee., 27. Rich in kindness and compassion shall become thee., 28. Enlightened shall become thee.

tit.e: The relationship to the thought of Juo (Ten Kings)
tit.cmt: 十王に (Ten Kings) と補足しました。

sen.j: 偽経とされる閻羅王授記四衆逆修生七往生浄土経（預修十王生七経）や十王経（地蔵菩薩発心因縁十王経）によって、道教の十王信仰と結びついて地蔵菩薩を閻魔と閻魔と同一の存在であるという信仰が広まった。
sen.e: By Enra-o-juki Shishu Gyakushu Shoshichiojo Jodo-kyo Sutra (閻羅王授記四衆逆修生七往生浄土経) (Yoshu Juo Shoshichi-kyo Sutra, Yuxiu Shiwang Shengqijing Sutra) and Juo-kyo Sutra (Jizo Bosatsu Hossin Innen Juo-kyo Sutra), a belieaf that Jizo Bosatsu is the same entity as Emma, tied with Juo belieaf in Taoism.
sen.cmt: 原文中、「閻魔と閻魔と」と繰り返されていますが誤記と判断しました。
sen.e: Among Enra-o-juki Shishu Gyakushu Shoshichiojo Jodo-kyo Sutra (閻羅王授記四衆逆修生七往生浄土経) (Yoshu Juo Shoshichi-kyo Sutra, Yuxiu Shiwang Shengqijing Sutra) and Juo-kyo Sutra (Jizo Bosatsu Hossin Innen Juo-kyo Sutra), a belief that Jizo Bosatsu is the same entity as Emma, tied with Juo belief in Taoism.

Among Enra-o-juki Shishu Gyakushu Shoshichiojo Jodo-kyo Sutra (閻羅王授記四衆逆修生七往生浄土経) (Yoshu Juo Shoshichi-kyo Sutra, Yuxiu Shiwang Shengqijing Sutra) and Juo-kyo Sutra (Jizo Bosatsu Hossin Innen Juo-kyo Sutra), a belief that Jizo Bosatsu is the same entity as Enma, tied with Juo belief in Taoism.

sen.j: 閻魔王は地蔵菩薩として人々の様子を事細かに見ているため、綿密に死者を裁くことができるとする。
sen.e: Assording to that, the king Emma watches people in detail as Jizo Bosatsu so that he can bring the dead to justice closely.
According to that, the king Emma watches people closely as Jizo Bosatsu so that he can fairly bring the dead to justice.
According to that, the king Enma watches people closely as Jizo Bosatsu so that he can fairly bring the dead to justice.

tit.j: 日本における地蔵信仰

sen.j: 日本においては、浄土信仰が普及した平安時代以降、極楽浄土に往生のかなわない衆生は、必ず地獄へ堕ちるものという信仰が強まり、地蔵に対して、地獄における責め苦からの救済を欣求するようになった。
sen.e: In Japan since Heian Period, when the Pure Land Faith widespread, people had increasingly believed that the living things who could not reborn in Land-of- Bliss after death inevitably went to hell, so that they had become to hope a relief from sufferring in hell aigaint Jizo Bosatsu.

In Japan since the Heian period, when the Pure Land Faith was widespread, people increasingly believed that the living things who could not be reborn in the Land of Bliss after death inevitably went to Hell, so that they had to hope for relief from their suffering in Hell based on the suffering of Jizo Bosatsu.

In Japan since the Heian period, when the Pure Land Faith was widespread, people increasingly believed that the living things who could not be reborn in the Land of Bliss after death inevitably went to Hell, so that they had to hope from Jizo Bosatsu for relief from their suffering in Hell.
sen.cmt: from Jizo Bosatsu としました。

sen.j: 賽の河原で獄卒に責められる子供を地蔵菩薩が守るという民間信仰もあり、子供や水子の供養でも地蔵信仰を集めた。
sen.e: There is a fork belief that Jizo Bosatsu guard children who are blamed by low-level functionary at Sai-no-kawara, the Children's limbo, so that Jizo Bosatsu has been worshipped for veneration of childreden and miscarried foetuses.

There is a folk belief that Jizo Bosatsu guards children who are relegated to status as low-level functionaries in Sai-no-kawara (the limbo of children) so that Jizo Bosatsu has been worshipped for the veneration of children and miscarried fetuses.

There is a folk belief that Jizo Bosatsu guards children who are bullied by ogres at Sai-no-kawara (the limbo of children) so that Jizo Bosatsu has been worshipped for the veneration of children and miscarried fetuses.
sen.cmt: who are relegated to status as low-level functionaries ではなく、 who are bullied by ogres at Sai-no-kawara としました。

sen.j: また、関西では地蔵盆は子供の祭りとして扱われる。
sen.e: Besides, in Kansai district Jizo Bon is held as children's festival.
Moreover, in the Kansai district Jizo Bon is held as a children's festival.
Moreover, in the Kansai district Jizo Bon is held as a children's festival.

sen.j: また道祖神と習合したため、日本全国の路傍で石像が数多く祀られた。
sen.e: In addition, it is syncretized with Doso-shin, Doso-jin, traveler's guardian deity, so that many stone statues were shrined by the roadside all over Japan.
Additionally, it has been syncretized with Doso-shin (Doso-jin) the traveler's guardian deity, so that many stone statues were enshrined by the roadsides throughout Japan.

sen.j: 中国においては、地蔵菩薩は十王思想と結びついて地藏王菩薩とも呼ばれ、冥界の教主としても信仰される。
sen.e: In China Jizo Bosatsu is called Jizo-o Bosatsu tied with Juo thought and is worshipped as a master of the underworld.
In China, Jizo Bosatsu is called Jizo-o Bosatsu (tied with Juo thought) and is worshipped as a master of the underworld.
In China, Jizo Bosatsu is called Jizo-o Bosatsu (tied with Juo thought) and is worshipped as a master of the underworld.

sen.j: 閻魔王として死者を裁くことから、主に死後の（地獄からの）救済を願って信仰される。
sen.e: Because it brings the dead to justice as the king Emma, it is mainly worshipped in order to wish a relief (from hell) after death.
Because it brings the dead to justice as the king Emma, it is mainly worshipped in order to wish for relief (from Hell) after death.

sen.j: 日本の神奈川県横浜市中区にも、華僑によって建立された死者の永眠を祀る地藏王廟（中華義荘）がある。
sen.e: In Naka Ward Yokohama City Kanagawa Prefecture Japan there exists Jiso-o-byo (Chuka Giso) which was built by Chinese residents and enshrines rest of the dead.

sen.cmt: Ward Jiso ではなく、Jizo ではないかと解釈しました。 地藏王廟は寺院のため、地藏王廟（中華義荘）をJizo-o-byo Temple (Chuka Giso) (Chinese cemetary) としました。

sen.j: 地藏王菩薩の聖地は、安徽省にある九華山である。
sen.e: The sacred place of Jiso-o Bosatsu is Jiuhuashan Mountain in Anhui Province.
The sacred place of Jiso-o Bosatsu is Mt. Jiuhuashan, in Anhui Province.

sen.j: これは、新羅の金和尚、金地蔵とも呼ばれる地蔵という僧（696年 - 794年）が、この地にある化城寺に住したことに因むものである。
sen.e: This is based on the fact that a priest Jizo (696-794), who is also called Kin-osho or Kana Jizo in Shiragi, the Silla Dynasty, lived in Huacheng Temple of this place.
This is based on the fact that a priest Jizo (696 to 794), who is also called Kin-osho or Kana Jizo in Shiragi, the Silla dynasty, lived in Huacheng Temple at this place.

sen.j: 齢九十九で、この地で入滅した地蔵は、3年後に棺を開いて塔に奉安しようとしたところ、その顔貌が生前と全く変わることがなかったことなどから、地蔵を地藏王菩薩と同一視する信仰が生まれ、その起塔の地が地藏王菩薩の聖地となったものである。
sen.e: Jizo, who entered nirvana in this place at the age of 99, remained the same figure as living when his casket was opened three years later in orde to enshrine in a tower, so that the faith to see him as the same as Jiso-o Bosatsu was created and the place of the tower became a sacred place of Jiso-o Bosatsu.

Jizo, who entered nirvana in this place at the age of 99, remained the same figure as living when his casket was opened three years later in order to be enshrined in a tower, so that the faith to see him as the same as Jiso-o Bosatsu was created and the place of the tower became a sacred site of Jiso-o Bosatsu.

sen.j: その故事によって、文殊菩薩の五台山、普賢菩薩の峨眉山、観音菩薩の普陀山と並ぶ中国仏教の聖地として、今日まで信仰を集めている。
sen.e: According to that historical event, it has been worshipped until now as a sacred place in Chinese Buddhism as well as Wutai Shan Mountain of Monju Bosatsu, Emeishan mountain of Fugen Bosatsu and Putuo Mountain of Kannon Bosatsu.

sen.j: これは、仏教の六道輪廻の思想（全ての生命は6種の世界に生まれ変わりを繰り返すとする）に基づき、六道のそれぞれを6種の地蔵が救うとする説から生まれたものである。
sen.e: This is originated from a theory that 6 kind of Jizo Bosatsu relieve each Six World, based on the thought of Rokudo-rinne, Rebirth in the Six Worlds (all lives repeat incarnation in the six worlds) in Buddhism.

This is originated from a theory that six kinds of Jizo Bosatsu relieve each of the six worlds, based on the Buddhist concept of Rokudo-rinne or Rebirth in the Six Worlds (whereby all lives repeat incarnation in the six worlds).

sen.j: 地獄道、餓鬼道、畜生道、修羅道、人道、天道の順に檀陀（だんだ）地蔵、宝珠地蔵、宝印地蔵、持地地蔵、除蓋障（じょがいしょう）地蔵、日光地蔵と称する場合と、それぞれを金剛願地蔵、金剛宝地蔵、金剛悲地蔵、金剛幢地蔵、放光王地蔵、預天賀地蔵と称する場合が多いが、文献によっては以上のいずれとも異なる名称を挙げている物もある。

tit.j: 地蔵菩薩に関する伝承

tit.e: The Transmigration of the kings in ancient India
The transmigration of the kings in ancient India
The transmigration of the kings in ancient India

sen.j: 過去久遠の昔、インドに大変慈悲深い2人の王がいた。
sen.e: A long time ago there lived two kings who were plenteous in mercy in India.
A long time ago there lived two kings who were abundantly merciful in India.
A long time ago there lived two kings who were abundantly merciful in India.

sen.j: 一人は自らが仏となることで人を救おうと考え、一切智威如来という仏になった。
sen.e: The one thought that he would relief peope by becoming Buddha by himself and became Buddha named Issaichii-nyorai.
One of the kings thought he would relieve people by becoming Buddha by himself, and he became the Buddha called Issaichii-nyorai.
One of the kings thought he would relieve people by becoming Buddha by himself, and he became the Buddha called Issaichii-nyorai.

sen.j: だが、もう一人の王は仏になる力を持ちながら、あえて仏となることを拒否し、自らの意で人の身のまま地獄に落ち、すべての苦悩とさ迷い続ける魂を救おうとした。
sen.e: However, the other king dared to reject becoming Buddha in spite of being capable to become Buddha, went to hell remaining a human by his will and tried to relieve all troubles and wondering souls continuously.

However, the other king dared to reject becoming Buddha in spite of being capable of doing so; instead he willingly went to Hell, keeping his human form, and continuously endeavored to relieve all the troubles and wandering of souls.

sen.j: それが地蔵菩薩である。
sen.e: He is Jizo Bosatsu.

sen.j: 地蔵菩薩の霊験は膨大にあり、人々の罪業を滅し成仏させるとか、苦悩する人々の身代わりになって救済するという説話が多い。
sen.e: There are many stories that miraculous efficacy of Jizo Bosatsu are enormous to diminish people's sins and make them Buddha or he relieve people as a scapegoaterof suffering people.
There are many stories that the miraculous efficacy of Jizo Bosatsu is enormous enough to diminish people's sins and make them Buddha, and that he relieves people as a scapegoat for their suffering.

tit.e: The guarding or relief of children
The guarding or relief of children

sen.j: 菩薩は如来に次ぐ高い見地に住する仏であるが、地蔵菩薩は「一斉衆生済度の請願を果たさずば、我、菩薩界に戻らじ」との決意でその地位を退し、六道を自らの足で行脚して、救われない衆生、親より先に世を去った幼い子供の魂を救って旅を続ける。
sen.e: Although Bosatsu is a Buddha ranked on the high status next to Nyorai, Jizo Bosatsu stepped down from the status with determination that ' I won't go back to Bosatsu world unless my wish to relieve all living things comes true.', and continued travel to releave unreleaved living things and the soul of young chidren who died earlier than their paretnts, walking in Rokudo by own foot.

sen.j: 幼い子供が親より先に世を去ると、親を悲しませ親孝行の功徳も積んでいないことから、三途の川を渡れず賽の河原で鬼のいじめに遭いながら石の塔婆作りを永遠に続けなければならないとされる。
sen.e: It is said that a young child who died earlier than their parents can not crass Sanzu River and has to continue to make a stone stopa forever, suffering from bullying of ogre at Sai-no-kawara because it makes its parents grief and does not pile pious acts of filial devotion to parents.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that a young child who dies before his parents cannot cross the Sanzu River but must continue to make a stone stop forever; that he must suffer from the bullying of ogres at Sai-no-kawara because he makes his parents grieve; and that he will not accrue pious acts of filial devotion to his parents.

It is said that a young child who dies before his parents cannot cross the Sanzu River but must continue to build a stone stupa forever; that he must suffer from the bullying of ogres at Sai-no-kawara because he makes his parents grieve; and that he will not accrue pious acts of filial devotion to his parents.
sen.cmt: 石の塔婆作りを build a stone stupa としました。

sen.j: 賽の河原に率先して足を運んでは鬼から子供達を守ってやり、仏法や経文を聞かせて徳を与え、成仏への道を開いていく逸話は有名である。
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote that Jizo Bosatsu is first to go to Sai-no-kawara and guards children from ogre, gives virtue by preaching Buddhism daharma and sutras, and leads them to the way to become Buddha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: このように、地蔵菩薩は最も弱い立場の人々を最優先で救済する菩薩であることから、古来より絶大な信仰の対象となった。
sen.e: As mentioned above, Jizo Bosatsu is the Bosatsu who relieve the weakest people above everything else so that it has been worshipped enormously since ancient times.

sen.j: 施餓鬼法要との関係
sen.e: Relationship with the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival
Relationship to the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival
Relationship to the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival

sen.j: また後年になると、地蔵菩薩の足下には餓鬼界への入口が開いているとする説が広く説かれるようになる。
sen.e: In more recent times a story that the spot under Jizo Bosatsu's feet is the entance of the world of Gaki, hungry ghosts, has widespread.
In more recent times there has been a widespread story that the spot under Jizo Bosatsu's feet is the entrance of the world of Gaki (hungry ghosts).

sen.j: 地蔵菩薩像に水を注ぐと、地下で永い苦しみに喘ぐ餓鬼の口にその水が入る。
sen.e: When water is poured on the state of Jizo Bosatsu, it pours into the mouth of Gaki who suffers troubles forever in the underground.
When water is poured on the statue of Jizo Bosatsu, it pours into the mouth of Gaki, who suffers forever in the netherworld.
When water is poured on the statue of Jizo Bosatsu, it pours into the mouth of Gaki, who suffers forever in the netherworld.

sen.j: 仏教上における餓鬼は、生前嘘を他言した罪で燃える舌を持っており、口に入れた飲食物は炎を上げて燃え尽き飲み食いすることは出来ないが、地蔵菩薩の慈悲を通した水は餓鬼の喉にも届き、暫くの間苦しみがとぎれると言われている（その間に供養を捧げたり得の高い経文を聞かせたりして成仏を願うのが施餓鬼の法要の一端でもある）。
sen.e: It is said that although Gaki in Buddhism has a burning tongue because of the sin to had told a lie in life so that he can not drink or eat because everything in his mouth is burnd down, the water through Jizo Bosatsu's mercy can reach Gaki's throut and he can interruput suffering for a while (during that, people prays for Gaki to become Buddha by reading Mass and reciting sutras with great virtue as a part of the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival.)

It is said that although Gaki in Buddhism has a burning tongue because of the sin of having told a lie in life so that he cannot drink or eat because everything in his mouth is burned away, the water through Jizo Bosatsu's mercy can reach Gaki's throat and he can interrupt suffering for a while (during which people pray for Gaki to become Buddha by reading mass and reciting sutras with great virtue as part of the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival).

It is said that although Gaki in Buddhism has a burning tongue because of the sin of having told a lie in life so that he cannot drink or eat because everything in his mouth is burned away, the water through Jizo Bosatsu's mercy can reach Gaki's throat and he can interrupt suffering for a while (during which people pray for Gaki to become Buddha by reading mass and reciting sutras with great virtue as part of the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival).

sen.j: これは六道全てに隔てなく慈悲を注ぐと言われる地蔵菩薩の功徳を表す説であり、施餓鬼法要と地蔵菩薩は深い関係として成立していった。
sen.e: This is a story which shows pious act of Jizo Bosatsu who is said to pour mercy to all six worlds without prejudice, and the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival was established with relationship woth Jizo Bosatsu.

This is a story that shows the pious acts of Jizo Bosatsu, who is said to pour mercy upon all six worlds without prejudice; accordingly, the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival was established as associated with Jizo Bosatsu.

This is a story that shows the pious acts of Jizo Bosatsu, who is said to pour mercy upon all six worlds without prejudice; accordingly, the Hungry Ghosts' Feeding Festival was established as associated with Jizo Bosatsu.

sen.j: 仏教上では、非道者で仏法を否定、誹謗する者を一闡提（略して闡提）というが、これには単に「成仏し難い者」という意味もあることから、一切の衆生を救う大いなる慈悲の意志で、あえて成仏を取り止めた地蔵菩薩や観音菩薩のような菩薩を「大悲闡提」と称し、通常の闡提とは明確に区別する。
sen.e: In Buddhism a nefarious person who denies and critisize Buddhism is called Ichi-Sendai (一闡提) (Sendai in short), which also means simply 'a person who has difficulty to become Buddha,' so that Bosatsus such as Jizo Bosatsu and Kannon Bosatsu, who dared not to become Buddda by great mercy to relieve all living things, are called 'Daihi Sendai' and distinguised clealy from normal Sendai.

In Buddhism a nefarious person who denies and criticizes Buddhism is called ichi-sendai (一闡提) (or simply sendai), which also means simply 'a person who has difficulty becoming Buddha,' so that Bosatsus such as Jizo Bosatsu and Kannon Bosatsu, who dared not to become Buddha through their great mercy in relieving all living things, are called 'Daihi Sendai' and are clearly distinguished from the normal sendai.

In Buddhism a nefarious person who denies and criticizes Buddhism is called ichi-sendai (一闡提) (or simply sendai), which also means simply 'a person who has difficulty becoming Buddha,' so that Bosatsus such as Jizo Bosatsu and Kannon Bosatsu, who dared not to become Buddha through their great mercy in relieving all living things, are called 'Daihi Sendai' and are clearly distinguished from the normal sendai.

sen.j: 先に述べた「六地蔵」とは六道それぞれを守護する立場の地蔵尊であり、他界への旅立ちの場である葬儀場や墓に多く建てられた。
sen.e: Abobe 'Rokujizo' is Jizo Bosatsu who guard each six worlds so that many statues were built at funeral homes and graves.

The above 'Rokujizo' is Jizo-son (statues of Jizo), who guards each of the six worlds, and therefore many statues were placed at funeral homes and graves.

sen.j: また道祖神信仰と結びつき、町外れや辻に「町の結界の守護神」として建てられることも多い。
sen.e: In addition, it was combined with the faith for Doso-shin, many statues were built as 'guardian deity of the barrier of town' outside of town or on strees.

sen.j: これを本尊とする祭りとして地蔵盆がある。

sen.j: また道祖神のことをシャグジともいうことから、シャグジに将軍の字を当て、道祖神と習合した地蔵を将軍地蔵(勝軍とも書く)とも呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Besides, since Doso-shin is called Shaguji, the Jizo Bosatsu which syncretized with Doso-shin became to be called Shogun Jizo by putting the letters of Shogun on Shaguji.

sen.cmt: 将軍と勝軍と漢字を追加しました。

sen.j: なお、民間説話である西遊記では冥界を司るとして地藏王菩薩が孫悟空（斉天大聖）の暴れっぷりを地獄から天の玉皇大帝に上奏するとして描かれている。
